description:
"Villa Angaran San Giuseppe" is a social project of "Rete Pictor", a consortium of cooperatives: "Luoghi Comuni" (type B cooperative for job placement), "Adelante" (type A cooperative for personal services) and "Conca d'Oro" (type A and B). This project was entrusted with the recovery and rehabilitation of a 16th-century villa owned by the Jesuit Fathers, given on a free loan. The project to restore and redevelop Villa Angaran San Giuseppe started in 2015. 

The project consists of a restaurant and bar ("Todomodo"), fields for the production of organic vegetables, day care centres for adolescents, children and persons with disability, a guest house, a liquor factory, rented spaces for events and conferences, art workshops, shared vegetable gardens for members, a vineyard, and the organisation of cultural events ("People First Park": concerts, readings/seminars, cultural reviews), and spaces for the sale of products from partner projects. 

Villa Angaran San Giuseppe is a well known meeting place for the community of Bassano del Grappa. Its approach to food production is organic and eco-friendly and subordinate to the social inclusion of the people in the day care centre. The project combines principles of environmental sustainability with social sustainability, presents itself as a place open to all differences and aspires to become a laboratory where a new idea of society is developed.
name: Villa Angaran San Giuseppe

feedback.content: Hi there, I've just changed a couple of details. Hoping that sounds good. Thanks, Lele
